data.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops III
data.text:
Go to the configuration file location.

Open config.ini.

Find the line MaxFPS and set the value to 0.

Save the changes.

Notes

Changing this option disables FPS limiting altogether, which increases the loading speed of the levels and also allows the game to get a little more FPS than it was even at 1000.

Go to the configuration file location.

Open config.ini.

Find the line RestrictGraphicsOptions and edit the value from 1 to 0.

Save the changes.

Notes

If the game is installed in the default folder, the chosen file editor might need to be run as administrator.

Add +set fs_game offlinemp to the game's start parameters on windows. On mac, add an empty folder to /Contents/Assets/mods/ (create the mods folder if it's not already there) in the game's contents (left-click on the game's icon app) and then load the empty folder you created by clicking on 'mods' in the game's main menu and then clicking the name of the empty folder. The point of this is just to make the game run in modded mode, which allows it the user to play with offline bots. Any mod would work for this but, the empty folder would keep the game as vanilla as possible.

"offlinemp" here is just chosen as an example, any name will work. The game thereby creates a new mod directory under \players\mods\ with separate configuration files.

Go to <path-to-game>.

Remove d3dcompiler_46.dll.

Notes

Deleting this file does not affect the stability of the launch of the game. However, it is clearly outdated and does not allow the game to gain access to a newer version of the library from the Windows system, and blocks access to it, since it is located next to the game execution file.

Go to the configuration file location.

Open config.ini.

Find the line VideoMemory and edit the value from 0.75 or 0.90 to 1.

Also check the parameter StreamMinResident and change its value if required from 1 to 0.

Save the changes.

Notes

This setting helps to reduce the frequency of accessing the main RAM and allows the game to use all the video memory. It also reduces the frame time and increases the smoothness of the gameplay with a decrease in control response time.

On some configurations, these options can have a negative effect on performance, and in this case it's worthwhile to specify these values in the reverse order. This is due to the fact that these parameters also affect the drawing distance.

Go to the configuration file location.

Open config.ini.

Find the line SmoothFramerate and set the value to 0 from 1.

Save the changes.

Notes

This setting helps to prevent a strong drop in frame rates at certain points and also increases the smoothness of the gameplay.

May increase input lag and possibly performance degradation.

Go to the configuration file location.

Open config.ini.

Find the line MaxFrameLatency and set the value to 4 or 0.

Save the changes.

Also use D3DOverrider to force triple buffering on.

Notes

This greatly increases the smoothness and also greatly prevents a drop in the frame rate.

Usually the use of triple buffering only works with vertical sync enabled. But instead of using vertical synchronization, FastSync can be used in the settings of the Nvidia video card driver, as well as turning off vertical synchronization in the settings of the game itself. A similar option for AMD owners is called Enhanced Sync. This mode will not limit the FPS, but also allows the user to activate triple buffering.

The use of a larger number of prepared frames and the use of a triple buffer may increase input lags.

Go to the configuration file location.

Open config.ini.

Find the line SerializeRender and edit the value from 0 to 2.

Save the changes.

Notes

This might cause a slight decrease in FPS, but will make it stable and reduce the frametime, as well as improving the responsiveness in general.
